page.description: Allows you to open new dialogs from a dialog without them being children of the first dialog.
page.discussion: By default when Xdialog window opens another Xdialog (for example a button on dialog1 causes dialog2 to open), the second dialog is a "child" of the first dialog and when the first dialog closes, so will the second. The {nochildren} command allows you to open new dialogs from a dialog without them being children of the first dialog.
